level.heading: EXIT AND EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND DIRECTIONAL SIGNS (§ 14-903)

level.text: It shall be the duty of the operator of each housing business to maintain in an operable condition all emergency and exit lights.
The operator of each housing business shall maintain lighted exits and emergency lights from sunset to sunrise, and at other times when conditions warrant.
The operator of each housing business shall maintain all exit directional signs.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: The Housing Regulations of the District of Columbia, 5G DCRR § 3209, Commissioners’ Order 55-1503 (August 11, 1955).
